skill.name: pr-prepare
skill.description: Prepare pull request descriptions following project template. Activates on: prepare PR, create PR, pull request, ready for PR, draft PR, write PR
skill.summary: Prepare pull request descriptions following project template. Activates on: prepare PR, create PR, p...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only runs read-only git commands (status, log, diff) to gather context. No file writing, network calls, or external command execution beyond standard git operations. Purpose matches behavior exactly.

content.value_statement: Writing quality PR descriptions takes time and consistency. This skill automates the process by gathering git context, analyzing changes, and generating standardized PR descriptions following project templates and conventional commit formats.
actual_capabilities: Gather git context (status, branch comparison, changed files)
Analyze modified components and change purposes
Generate PR descriptions using project templates
Identify breaking changes and testing requirements
Format output for easy copy-paste to GitHub
limitations: Does not create or push branches automatically
Does not execute tests or linting (user must run these)
Does not interact with GitHub API directly
Does not handle complex merge conflict descriptions

use_cases.title: Quick PR documentation
use_cases.description: Save time preparing consistent, complete PR descriptions with proper context and testing status.

use_cases.title: Standardize PR descriptions
use_cases.description: Enforce consistent PR documentation across team members with standardized templates.

use_cases.title: Improve contribution quality
use_cases.description: Help contributors provide better PR descriptions that make review faster and easier.

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR preparation
prompt_templates.scenario: Prepare a PR for your branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Can you prepare the PR for my current branch?

prompt_templates.title: With specific focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a PR description highlighting any breaking changes and migration steps needed.

prompt_templates.title: For code review
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR description that clearly shows what areas need the most review attention.

prompt_templates.title: With testing notes
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare the PR description and include what test coverage exists for these changes.

output_examples.input: Can you prepare the PR for my feature branch?
output: **Suggested Title**: `feat: add user authentication with OAuth2`
Add OAuth2 authentication supporting Google and GitHub providers.
- **auth/oauth.py**: OAuth2 client implementation with token refresh
- Users can sign in with Google or GitHub
- Secure session management with httponly cookies

best_practices: Run the full test suite before preparing your PR to confirm everything passes
Review the generated description for accuracy before copying
Add follow-up items in the Notes section for future work
anti_patterns: Using the skill without first reviewing the actual changes yourself
Submitting PRs with only minimal descriptions lacking context

faq.question: Which tools is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude Code CLI. It does not activate in Claude Chat or Codex.

faq.question: What git commands does this skill run?
faq.answer: It runs read-only commands: git status, git log, and git diff to gather context safely.

faq.question: Does this skill create the PR on GitHub?
faq.answer: No, it only generates the description text. Users copy-paste to GitHub or use gh CLI.

faq.question: Is my code or credentials accessed?
faq.answer: Only read-only git metadata is accessed. No credentials, secrets, or source code is transmitted.

faq.question: What if the git history is messy?
faq.answer: The skill works with any history but recommends clean commit messages for better PR descriptions.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub PR templates?
faq.answer: GitHub templates provide format structure. This skill generates the actual content from your changes.
